Class ThresholdingStage

  • java.lang.Object
    • ThresholdingStage

  • public class ThresholdingStage
extends java.lang.Object
    ThresholdingStage is the stage for converting the Probability map we get from Weka Segmentation Stage to a binary image, where black represents cell boundry and white represents other area. TODO: Add the following methods: GraphCut, Local Threshold, Adaptive threshold

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThresholdingStage

        public ThresholdingStage(java.lang.String inputDir,
                         java.lang.String outputDir,
                         double lowerThreshold,
                         double upperThreshold)
        Constructor. Pass the address of directory containing the input images and the directory in which you want to store the output images and the specify the lower and upper threshold: 0.0 < lowerThreshold < upperThreshold < 1.0 We recommend you to explore the probability map and specify a proper threshold limit.
        Parameters:
        inputDir - absolute path of the directory of which all the images would be read
        outputDir - absolute path of the directory for storing the output images
        lowerThreshold - specifies the lower threshold for thresholding 0.0 < lowerThreshold < upperThreshold
        upperThreshold - specifies the upper threshold for thresholding lowerThreshold < lowerThreshold < 1.0

      • ThresholdingStage

        outputDir - absolute path of the directory for storing the output images
